bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Frank Carey, November 19, 1952

div1.p: Hench describes the upcoming Camp Lazear dedication. He suggests that Carey, of the Associated Press, notify his Havana correspondent to obtain preliminary information for press coverage.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Frank Carey, November 19, 1952
div1.opener:
November 19, 1952
Mr. Frank Carey
The Associated Press
230 Star Building
Washington 4, D. C.
My dear Mr. Carey:
div1.p:
In the past you have been interested in the story of Walter Reed and
Carlos Finlay and the conquest of yellow fever. I appreciated greatly
the clipping about Camp Lazear and the remains of Reed's little Building
No. 1 which you sent me last summer.

You will be pleased to know that the Cuban Government has finally acted and
will memorialize Camp Lazear at Quemados de Marianao (just outside Havana)
on Finlay's birthday, December 3, which is “Physicians' Day in Cuba.” They
have repaired extensively Building No. 1, graded the land and are making a
little park with a flag pole and a stone wall on which will be placed
bronze medallions to the main yellow fever personalities, Finlay, Delgado,
Reed, Carroll, Lazear, Agramonte and Wood and also bronze tablets on which
will appear the names of the various volunteers.

It is to be hoped that this will be an occasion for an increased Cuban-
American friendship, especially Cuban-American medical friendship. It is
particularly hoped that as they honor the Americans and we Americans who
attend honor Doctor Finlay who originated the mosquito theory of yellow
fever, the unfortunate debate regarding priority and division of honors
will end.

It occurred to me that you might care to notify your Havana correspondent
so that he could obtain some preliminary information ahead of the regular
news release. The affair is being sponsored in general by Ministry of
Sanitation and you could write to the Public Relations Officer of the
Ministerio de Salubridad y Asistencia Social, Havana, or to His Excellency
Dr. Jose Andreu, El Ministro de Salubridad y Asistencia Social. Actually,
the two men chiefly in charge of the affair are Dr. Pedro Nogueira, Marti 219,
Marianao, Havana, and Dr. Cesar Rodriguez Exposito, Secretary, Marti 219,
Marianao, Havana.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
